intro: Guatteriopsis hispida, commonly known as the rough guatteria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant morphology and ecological adaptation.
